topic.title: Removing a Ceph OSD Node
topic.abstract: Removing a Ceph Object Storage Daemon (OSD) node allows you to remove capacity.Perform the following steps to remove the Ceph Object Storage Daemon (OSD) node:

ol.li: Log in to the lifecycle manager.

Make a note of the OSD numbers on the OSD node to be removed. A sample of OSD node is as follows:$ ceph osd tree # id weight type name up/down reweight -1 6 root default -2 3 host padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0003-mgmt 0 1 osd.0 up 1 3 1 osd.3 up 1 6 1 osd.6 up 1 -4 3 host padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt 1 1 osd.1 up 1 4 1 osd.4 up 1 7 1 osd.7 up 1 -3 3 host padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0002-mgmt 2 1 osd.2 up 1 5 1 osd.5 up 1 8 1 osd.8 up 1
For example, to remove the OSD node padawan-ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt, the OSD numbers 1, 4, and 7 are relevant.

Run the following command to stop the OSDs running on the specific host:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-stop.yml --limit <osd-node-to-remove>
The hostname of the node can be found in the list generated from the output of the following command: grep hostname ~/helion/my_cloud/info/server_info.yml

Run the following command for each OSD number (obtained from step #2 above):ceph osd out <osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph auth del osd.<osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph osd crush remove osd.<osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph osd rm <osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster>Replace the string <ceph_cluster> with the name of your Ceph cluster (default cluster name is ceph).
To remove the OSD host from the Ceph CRUSH map, run the following command:ceph osd crush remove <host-name> Replace the string <host-name> in the above command.
Remove the OSD host from Cobbler: sudo cobbler system remove --name=<node> If you need to determine the OSD hostname in Cobbler you can use sudo cobbler system list
Run the Cobbler deploy playbook: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
Remove the OSD node from your server definitions file, path is usually: ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/servers.yml
Commit your configuration to the local git repo, as follows: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"
Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Update your deployment directory: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Remove the OSD host from Cobbler: sudo cobbler system remove --name=<node> If you need to determine the OSD hostname in Cobbler you can use sudo cobbler system list
Run the Cobbler deploy playbook: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost cobbler-deploy.yml
Log in to the OSD node and un-mount the data and journal disks. Also, remove the mount instructions for the same disks from the /etc/fstab file.
